critique: The executive order seems to be a formal document that aims to authorize the Director of the United States Information Agency to carry out certain functions. It doesn't seem to explicitly aim to evoke any strong emotions in the reader. However, one could argue that there might be a slight sense of surprise or interest due to the nature of the order. The order is transferring power, so that could cause a bit of surprise. The intensity of any emotion is likely to be very low.
